description: Comprehensive Beginner level Nepali learning data

grammar.title: Simple Present Tense
grammar.usage: म खान्छु, तिमी खान्छौ, ऊ खान्छ
grammar.notes: Endings: छु(I), छौ(you informal), छ(he/she), छौं(we), छन्(they)

grammar.title: Simple Past Tense
grammar.notes: Past endings vary by verb type

grammar.title: Question Words
grammar.pattern: के, को, कहाँ, कसरी, किन, कति
grammar.notes: Question words come before the verb

grammar.title: Negation
grammar.notes: दिनँ for I, दैन for he/she/it

grammar.title: To Be: हो/छ
grammar.usage: हो for identity, छ for state/location

grammar.title: Future Tense
grammar.notes: Add ने + छु/छ/छन् to verb stem

grammar.title: Imperative (Commands)
grammar.notes: नुहोस् is polite, नुस् is neutral

practice.question: What does 'नमस्ते' mean?
practice.explanation: नमस्ते (namaste) is the traditional Nepali greeting meaning Hello

practice.question: How do you say 'water' in Nepali?
Which ending is for 'I' in present tense?
practice.explanation: छु is used with म (I) in present tense

practice.question: Which postposition means 'in/at'?
practice.explanation: मा means in/at (e.g., घरमा = at home)

practice.question: What does 'म नेपाली हुँ' mean?
practice.explanation: म नेपाली हुँ = I am Nepali

practice.question: How do you say 'Thank you' in Nepali?
